attributes.action: Members of Parliament must not have any income apart from their MPs salary
attributes.additional_details:
MPs must make sure that they are fully impartial and having a second income from any source may mean they are prejudiced in their decisions. Income means being paid a wage, expenses, shares, receiving gifts or having money in trust funds. 
An MP must also not do any unpaid work that may be classed as nepotism.
attributes.background: Being a Member of Parliament is a full time job and this should be their only paid employment.
